MotoGP KEK Mandalika, Dongkrak Pertumbuhan Ekonomi
01 Nov 2019, 17:02 by Hayatun Sofian


MotoGP KEK Mandalika, Dongkrak Pertumbuhan Ekonomi

KBRN, Mataram : Managemen Indonesian Tourism Development Coorporate (ITDC) menjajaki dampak ekonomi dari penyelenggaraan MotoGP, dengan berkaca pada penyelenggaran MotoGP disejumlah Negara.Komisaris PT. ITDC, Haji Lalu Gita Aryadi mengatakan, beberapa negara penyelenggara MotoGP akan dikunjungi untuk melihat potensi ekonomi yang ditimbulkan, seperti di Malaysia, Thailand dan Australia.Potensi ekonomi tersebut dapat dikembangkan sejak sircuit MotoGP Mandalika Lombok Tengah dikembangkan.“Sejauh ini, managemen ITDC bersama Pemerintah daerah melihat potensi ekonomi dari investasi transportasi, perhotelan dan restoran serta tenaga kerja,” katanya, Jumat (1/11/2019).Gita Aryadi mengatakan, PT. ITDC bersama Pemerintah Daerah berikhtiar kuat agar keberadaan sircuit itu nantinya berdampak signifikan terhadap perekonomian masyarakat.Saat ini saja, pembangunan kawasan tersebut sudah berdampak terhadap perekonomian dari berbagai sektor, mulai pertanian, hotel dan restoran, hingga pada kebutuhan dasar pekerja kawasan tersebut.“Untuk itu, saya berharap dukungan maksimal dari semua pihak dalam menyukseskan pembangunan tersebut, terutama dalam menjaga kondusifitas daerah,” tutupnya.

MotoGP KEK Mandalika, Boosts Economic Growth
Nov 1 2019, 17:02 by Hayatun Sofian


MotoGP KEK Mandalika, Boosts Economic Growth

KBRN, Mataram: Indonesian Tourism Development Corporate Management (ITDC) is exploring the economic impact of the implementation of MotoGP, by reflecting on the implementation of MotoGP in a number of countries. Commissioner of PT. ITDC, Haji Lalu Gita Aryadi said, several MotoGP organizing countries would be visited to see the economic potential generated, such as in Malaysia, Thailand and Australia. The economic potential could be developed since the MotoGP Mandalika Central Lombok circuit was developed. "So far, ITDC management with the Government regions see the economic potential of transportation, hotel and restaurant investment and labor, "he said, Friday (11/01/2019). Gita Aryadi said, PT. ITDC together with the Regional Government endeavors that the presence of the circuits will have a significant impact on the economy of the community. At this time, the development of the region has had an impact on the economy of various sectors, from agriculture, hotels and restaurants, to the basic needs of the region's workers. "I hope the maximum support from all parties in the success of the development, especially in maintaining regional conduciveness," he concluded.
